title: JUnit 5
More proof script commands: hide and unhide.
description: And I have added a test case infrastructure.

title: Fix IllegalArgumentException being thrown from IssueDialog
description:
Title.

Same behaviour as before, just without the exceptions.

This happened e.g. when you load a proof that can only be loaded partially. The dialog does not have a source and the position is `-1, -1` which causes all the exceptions.

title: No dependencies as local jar files
description:
This MR removes all JAR files in the repository, as all dependencies are now available via maven repositories.

The latest missing library was DockingFrames, which is forked now in https://git.key-project.org/key-public/DockingFrames, and available via the KeY maven repo. 

The advantage for DockingFrames is now the availability of javadoc and source files via Maven.

title: Performance: Switching sequents
description:
Switching sequents is (was) very slow for large sequents.

I've noticed that most of the time is spent in `printSequent` which was called >10 times per switch. I managed to reduce it to 1-2 calls which makes switching sequents 6-8x faster (e.g. from 700ms to <100ms). 

This improves responsiveness a lot when working with large sequents.

title: Make AbbrevMap::getTerm fulfill its contract and prevent a NPE
description:
`AbbrevMap::getTerm` states that it returns `null` if no abbreviation is found but it throws an exception in this case.

This causes unexpected NPE's for users that expect `null` return values, e.g. `ExpressionBuidler::visitAbbreviation`.

I've checked all usages, it is always used in combination with a `null` check and is therefore safe to replace.

title: Clipboard: Replace nbsp from html document selection with normal spaces
description:
Replace nbsp unicode from html document selection with normal spaces before storing a string into the clipboard.

This behaviour is really unexpected and causes weird visual bugs with the built in editor and other non html displays when the given string is used in input files.

title: Specialized version of RuleContext::getText in TextualJMLAssertStatement::getClauseText
description: Use a specialized version of RuleContext::getText in TextualJMLAssertStatement::getClauseText inserting spaces between leaves.

title: insert jml assume and assert statements in the right order
description: this should fix #1667

title: fixes #1664
description:
Vararg argument (like `int...`) are not recognised if class files are loaded.

Should be fixed now.

title: Add documentation for TestTacletEquality and update oracle
description: fixes #1659

title: Remove last Eclipse files
description: Removes two files `PartListener{,2}.java` that were missing in !390.

title: Remove `ServiceLoaderUtil`
description:
The class `ServiceLoaderUtil` contains a function that was backported from Java 9+. The function allowed to load a list of classes which implements a service, rather than instances of the service. 

Since we switched to Java 11. The backport can be and is removed.

title: Enables JavaDL data types in ghost and model fields
Backport 2.10.0

This MR is necessary to execute the necessary CI pipelines.

title: Fix #1651.
description:
Closes #1651.

This bug was a consequence of my fix in !440.

While fixing it again, I also stumbled across another bug where after pruning a closed proof, it could not be closed again. The issue was the following: The one-step simplifier takes over some taclets, removing them from the taclet indices of all open goals. When the OSS is turned off or the user switches to another proof, these taclets are re-added to the indices of all open goals; then, when the user switches back to the original proof, the OSS takes them over again. The problem is the following:

1. Load some example (proof a). The OSS takes over the relevant taclets and removes them from the index of the open goal. 
2. Close the proof.
3. Switch to some other example (proof b). The OSS refreshes itself for proof b and tries to add the taken-over taclets to all open goals of proof a; but, since proof a is closed, there are no open goals.
4. Switch back to proof a and prune it. Since the taken-over taclets have not been re-added, the OSS cannot taken them over again. Thus, the OSS is not available during the proof.

I fixed this by removing and re-adding the taken-over taclets not just from all open goals, but also from all (open and closed) goals. @rbubel can you take a look at this?

If this branch fails the test suite and the fix turns out to be more complicated, another—less nice—fix would be to not allow pruning closed proofs.

title: cleanup key.core/…/TestJMLTranslator.java
description:
When trying to use options.release = 8 in build.gradle similar to my suggestion in !419 the only fallout was TestJMLTranslator.java because the build didn't find the unused `com.sun.java.accessibility.util.Translator` (probably some failed autoimport by an ide).

So I just cleaned up that file a little bit more with the help of intellij's `Inspect Code` feature.

There were some unused local variables since creation of that file, so I removed them and the commented out code that used them if there was any.

@weigl: you created that test in 1d370975b97

title: Add some examples + slightly changed structure/naming
description:
This MR brings the examples from chapter 16 (listings 16.1 to 16.3) of the KeY book to the examples. In addition, "New Book" is renamed to "The KeY Book" and moved upwards.

Until now, the "new" examples had to be downloaded here: https://www.key-project.org/thebook2/examples-from-the-book/
I decided not to include the examples for chapter 7 (JML introduction) from there since most of them contain either no proof obligations or no implementation.

For the test generation, I could not make it to work locally and thus did not include the examples either (to avoid advertising a possibly broken feature).

old | new
----|----
![screenshot_examples_before](/uploads/8477c2e62e6d9209cc6d3857a236977d/screenshot_examples_before.png) | ![screenshot_examples_after](/uploads/97ad6d5bbf5882382d0d93b879966592/screenshot_examples_after.png)

Possible future todos:
* clean up examples folder:
    * remove unused files
    * make the directory structure resemble the example structure
    * add some currently unlinked examples
* "Algorithms", "Dynamic Frames", "Information Flow" each present examples for a specific topic. In contrast, "Benchmark" is only a loose collection by paper/competition. Maybe we could assign those examples to the topics instead ...
* Should "Block & Loop Contracts" really be a child of "Dynamic Frames"?

title: Bugfix/workaround for #1622
description:
This MR fixes #1622 in the sense that no exceptions are thrown or printed at the console. However, the real problem seems to be that the file information of the origin labels is not correctly created and/or carried to nodes deeper in the proof.

Just for documentation:
If someone would be evil trying to load Java code from a file named `no file` or `<unknown>` into KeY, (at least) origin labels and symbolic execution highlighting will be broken. However, I think that loading Java code is currently limited (at least by the GUI) to loading from *.java files, so we can probably live with this .

title: Small GUI changes
description:
While testing/working through Chapter 15/16, I came across some (really) small inconveniences in the GUI:

- The content pane was titled "Inner Node View" on closed goals before, now it is called "Closed Goal" (that change is based on the assumption that an inner node only becomes a leaf if it represents a closed goal)

- The solver information window wasn't bound to any other window before which made it "disappear" behind the main window as soon as one clicked on the latter one. Also, closing the solver interface an information window resulted from didn't close that info window itself. Now, the information window stays in front of the main window and it is bound (parent) to the modular solver interface window.

title: Fix #1638: Move invocation of updateSMTSelectMenu()
description: There are at least two viable options for the location of the method's invocation (one other alternative would have been to call it in the SettingsDialog::apply() method), but it seems to make sense calling it immediately when a solver's settings are applied.

title: change SwitchToIf to create a if-else cascade
description:
change SwitchToIf to create a if-else cascade

# Why? 

As only one of the cases can be taken create an if-else cascade.
This should help to smaller proofs as it is now part of the transformed
program that only one case can be taken.

Fixes: #1583

# Features and Impact

Now only one proof branch should get created for each switch branch, instead of two.

Additionally the transformed code was made a little bit cleaner,
by only collecting statements of the switch until one jumps outside.
 
# Review

I didn't find a better place for tests as they should keep working even when the implementation of SwitchToIf changes.
And the should work before this change, except for labeled_case.key as that was a bug in the old implementation.

# Persons involved

idea: @lanzinger in #1583

title: Fix #1619.
description:
This fixes a potential NullPointerException in the One-Step Simplifier.

The problem is that when switching to a closed proof, `OneStepSimplifier::shutdownIndices()` is called and disposes the resources like the taclet index used by the OSS. When you then prune that closed proof and try doing anything, a NPE will be thrown.

The fix was to not call `shutdownIndices()` in that case. Since we only have one OSS per Java profile, and the resources are disposed and re-initialized whenever the user switches proofs, I don't think maintaining these resources causes any memory problems.

title: Workaround for crash of Javadoc 17
description:
This MR fixes #1594. It provides a workaround for a changed behavior between Javadoc 17 and earlier versions, which makes Javadoc crash on Jenkins.

The actual failing task was `gradle :keyext.interactionlog:javadoc`, which crashed due to a malformed html link.
While the crash is an actual bug in Javadoc (they changed much from 16 to 17 in the HtmlDocletWriter), the problem can be worked around by correcting the link to proper html format.

title: Prettify whitespace in examples
description:
I think it is really annoying and a little bit embarrassing that for some of the examples shipped with KeY the indentation is broken (see below). For this MR, I looked into all examples, replaced tabs and unified the indentation to 4 spaces.

![image](/uploads/e96d9035f930fab8796ee9c2dc8cacaf/image.png)

title: increment shadowJar plugin version
description:
Upgrades `shadow` (`shadowJar` task) plugin from version 5.0.0 to 7.1.0. 

This allows to build a fatJar of KeY under JDK 16+.

In addition, the gradle wrapper is changed from version 6.6 to 7.2, which allows to build KeY with JDK 16+.

title: Single dialog for all parser warnings and exceptions, better classpath error
description:
# Description
Provides a better error message for the classpath error, as discussed in [last KaKeY meeting](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/wikis/KaKey-2021-09-17). This provides nice syntax highlighting, a highlighting of the error location (now even with squiggly line), an "Edit File" action, clickable links in the error message which can be used to open a webpage (e.g., the classpath error links to https://key-project.org/docs/user/Classpath).

![image](/uploads/e08d8e911fda799b236510171ad91af6/image.png)

# Overview of all changes

* Provides a better classpath error message (+ link to docs).
* Removed explicit inclusion of position in this message of `BuildingException`. This problem led to wrong position in error messages, since the position has to be converted from 1-based to 0-based later on.
* Deleted duplicate test class `de.uka.ilkd.key.rule.TestTacletBuild`.
* Renamed `WarningsDialog` to `IssueDialog` and promoted it to the single dialog for all exceptions and warnings that may occur during parsing. The old `ExceptionDialog` is unused now (for the moment I just marked it as deprecated).
* Error positions are highlighted with squiggly lines now.
* Stacktrace is shown in a separate panel on demand, hidden by default (also requested in KaKeY).
* Replaced further information button by clickable links directly in warning message (links are converted to html automatically)
* Instead of opening the default text editor, the EditSourceFileAction is back (requested by @mulbrich). This has the benefit of placing the cursor directly at the problem location. For Java files, I also added syntax highlighting (see screenshot below) which refreshes when the user did not type anything for 800ms.

# Known bugs
* The text of error messages is not monotype currently.
* There are problems when entering a linebreak in the `EditSourceFileAction` (this duplicates some text).

# Old screenshots (only for documentation)
![image](/uploads/44213b5b2d9087eb7f9ed81e506c9d7d/image.png)
![image](/uploads/71c68a1fc66921fa7918efa821484dca/image.png)

title: add "-smt2" to call to z3 for older versions of z3
description: For Z3 v4.1 the default language is not SMT-LIB 2. I invoke it using z3 -in and should use z3 -smt2 -in. I will merge this tiny repair soon.

title: Bring INVISMT to KeY; Refactors SolverTypes
description:
This MR brings a new SMT Solver (INVISMT) to KeY.

[INVISMT](https://gitlab.com/invismt/invismt) was developed during the PSE course and provides and interactive Tool for the verification of SMT-lib files. 

Beside a new `SolverType`, this MR refactors the `SolverType` type hierarchy:

1. Individual `SolverType`s are promoted to regular classes from anonymous class
2. Solver types are dynamically via `ServiceLoader` 
3. `SolverData` is dynamically created (proof independent SMT settings)
4. PI-SMT settings stores solver-specific settings per class and not per instance


Runs with the latest INVISMT key-branch version.

title: Unifying the user interface further
description:
This MR contains the following changes:
* set the parent for all dialogs to center them over their parent component (usually the main window)
* avoid NPEs when no proof is loaded but font size is changed
* uniformly use the button captions "OK", "Apply", and "Cancel" for dialogs
* always use KeYFileChooser when a file should be loaded/saved (to have bookmarks, file filters, and filename suggestions available)
* applied UI style guide: indicate actions that need additional user input with `...`, e.g. `Save...`
* code cleanup: deleted some now unused classes and methods
* also fixes some smaller GUI bugs, e.g. ignored `Cancel` button when loading user-defined taclets

Fixes #1496 (I think we should close this for now and track future problems in separate issues)

title: Fix comment attachment in recoder
description:
This MR fixes the #1, fixes #824 and fixes #1581. 

JML statements, which are the last statements in a statement block, are not recognized. It was often told that this is a problem of the `recoder` library. But it is a problem of KeY, as the `recoder` is correctly delivering the JML statements as comments, and the post-processing in KeY in the buggy point. 

**Background:** KeY attaches the (JML) comments to AST node. In detail, KeY attaches a comment to the next AST node following the comment. This makes sense in various place: Loop contracts/invariants are attached to loops (mostly), JML statements are attached to the next statement. If there is not *next statement* or following AST node, the comment is attached to the root AST node (in most cases a compilation unit). 

**Change:** This MR changes the AST node resolution in the cases, where no next AST node could be resolved. If the comment is last in a StatementBlock, an *empty statement* is created to which the comment is attached. To keep the creation of empty statements to a minimum, some clearly non-JML comments are ignored. In all other cases, the old behavior is preserved.

This MR also brings **new test cases** to test the attachment algorithm explicitly.

title: Fix auxiliary contract collisions
description:
Fixes a bug where an auxiliary specification (loop invariant, block contract, or assertion) could be applied at the wrong place.

The reason for this bug is that the `SpecificationRepository` stores auxiliary specifications by (a) the block/loop to which they belong, and (b) the line number in which they occur. Thus, if the exact same block/loop occurs in two different files at the same line number, their specifications are stored with the same key.

In the attached example, the assertion in `TestA.java` and the one in `TestB.java` are at the same line number. When trying to prove `TestA.java`, both assertions are applied, making the proof unclosable.

[Test.zip](/uploads/b16590998278a311cac03b0265986c62/Test.zip)

title: Name self, exc and similar variables without suffix
description:
Fixing #1552

Loading proof obligations produces variables like `self_25`. When saving and reloading, however, it would be named `self` only. Thus, proofs with interaction or with instantiations which require these variables cannot be reloaded.

There is a method `AbstractOperationPO.isMakeNamesUnique` where one can set this flag. Martin Hentschel has introduced this mechanism.

Is it safe to change this flag from `true` to `false`?

/cc @rbubel

title: Performance tuning and fixes for ProofTree
description:
This MR contains massive performance improvements for the `ProofTreeView`. Expanding and collapsing many nodes via the context menu is now much faster.

# Performance improvements
Here are some numbers for the proof of the contract of `eInsertionSort` from the [DualPivotQuickSort case study](https://www.key-project.org/2017/08/17/dual-pivot/), which has about 162k nodes (180k when also counting OSS nodes):
|    action    | current master | tuned version (this branch) |
|--------------|----------------|-----------------------------|
| expand all   |       24s      |              ~1s            |
| collapse all |       23s      |              ~1s            |

However, the effect can also be observed clearly for example when expanding all nodes of the `SumAndMax` example.

# Changes in effect of `expand/collapse below`
Despite the name, the `expand/collapse below` actions currently also operated on all nodes of the same level. This is fixed now.

# Refactoring of `ExpansionState` class
The class `ExpansionState` which is responsible for storing the expanded paths of `JTree`, had lots of legacy (Java before Generics) and unused code which has been cleaned up and is now also properly documented.

# Changes and drawback
Some profiling showed that most of the time when expanding/collapsing was consumed by lots and lots of TreeExpandedEvents that were sent to the TreeExpansionListeners. The proof tree has two of those: One is for redrawing, and the other one is for the `ExpansionState`, which holds a set to store exactly the expanded paths. While the latter one is quite fast, the former one itself performs queries to the `JTree` to determine the expanded paths. As a solution, the new implementation temporarily disables/unregisters all listeners expect the `ExpansionState` listener.

Another tuning is to set a constant row height (depending on the current font size), which avoid the need to determine the height of each individual row by its content, which should be ok for the proof tree, we only have text rows of equal height. This also greatly speeds up the rendering (even more in combination with the `largeModels` property of the `JTree`).

The drawback is that the `ExpansionState` class now is tailored a bit to our proof tree use case. In particular, if you would have another `JTree` with more TreeExpansionListeners, these would possibly not get all the necessary events. Therefore, the `ExpansionState` has been renamed to `ProofTreeExpansionState` for clarity.

This merge request fixes this part of #1530 (the original bug of the issue has already been fixed).

title: Fix proof loading in the CLI
description:
Currently, KeY is unable to load contracts from the commmand-line interface using the `--auto` option. Directly loading a `.proof` or `.key` file works, but loading a `.java` file and then specifying the contract to prove in the CLI leads to the following error:

```
florian@i57pclanzinger:~/git/key/key$ java -jar key.ui/build/libs/key-2.9-exe.jar --auto /home/florian/s/SumAndMax.java 
KeY Version 2.9 (internal: ad9f760ee1)
© Copyright 2001–2020 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Chalmers University of Technology, and Technische Universität Darmstadt
KeY is protected by the GNU General Public License

Using assertions ...
Available Contracts: 
Contract 0:
   Method: SumAndMax::sumAndMax
   PO:JML normal_behavior operation contract 0
Choose PO, enter number between 0 and 0
PO nr: 0
Contract: pre: {heap=and(all{i:int}(imp(and(and(leq(Z(0(#)),i),lt(i,length(a)))<<SC>>,inInt(i)),leq(Z(0(#)),int::select(heap,a,arr(i)))))<<origin(requires @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 7) ([])>>,and(java.lang.Object::<inv>(heap,self)<<impl>>,not(equals(a,null))<<origin(requires (implicit)) ([])>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>}; mby: null; post: {heap=and(and(all{i:int}(imp(and(and(leq(Z(0(#)),i),lt(i,length(a)))<<SC>>,inInt(i)),leq(int::select(heap,a,arr(i)),int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$max))))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 9) ([])>>,and(imp(gt(length(a),Z(0(#))),exists{i:int}(and(and(and(leq(Z(0(#)),i),lt(i,length(a)))<<SC>>,inInt(i)),equals(int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$max),int::select(heap,a,arr(i))))<<SC>>))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 10) ([])>>,and(equals(int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$sum),javaCastInt(bsum{i:int}(Z(0(#)),length(a),int::select(heap,a,arr(i)))))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 12) ([])>>,and(leq(int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$sum),javaMulInt(length(a),int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$max)))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 13) ([])>>,java.lang.Object::<inv>(heap,self)<<impl>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>,equals(exc<<origin(ensures (implicit)) ([])>>,null)<<impl, origin(ensures (implicit)) ([])>>)}; mods: {heap=union(singleton(self,SumAndMax::$sum),singleton(self,SumAndMax::$max))<<origin(assignable @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 8) ([])>>, savedHeap=null}; hasMod: {heap=true, savedHeap=true}; termination: diamond; transaction: false
Proof loading failed
```

This branch fixes the issue. KeY now correctly loads the chosen contract and tries to prove it using default settings:

```
florian@i57pclanzinger:~/git/key/key$ java -jar key.ui/build/libs/key-2.9-exe.jar --auto /home/florian/s/SumAndMax.java 
KeY Version 2.9 (internal: ad9f760ee1)
© Copyright 2001–2020 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Chalmers University of Technology, and Technische Universität Darmstadt
KeY is protected by the GNU General Public License

Using assertions ...
Available Contracts: 
Contract 0:
   Method: SumAndMax::sumAndMax
   PO:JML normal_behavior operation contract 0
Choose PO, enter number between 0 and 0
PO nr: 0
Contract: pre: {heap=and(all{i:int}(imp(and(and(leq(Z(0(#)),i),lt(i,length(a)))<<SC>>,inInt(i)),leq(Z(0(#)),int::select(heap,a,arr(i)))))<<origin(requires @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 7) ([])>>,and(java.lang.Object::<inv>(heap,self)<<impl>>,not(equals(a,null))<<origin(requires (implicit)) ([])>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>}; mby: null; post: {heap=and(and(all{i:int}(imp(and(and(leq(Z(0(#)),i),lt(i,length(a)))<<SC>>,inInt(i)),leq(int::select(heap,a,arr(i)),int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$max))))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 9) ([])>>,and(imp(gt(length(a),Z(0(#))),exists{i:int}(and(and(and(leq(Z(0(#)),i),lt(i,length(a)))<<SC>>,inInt(i)),equals(int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$max),int::select(heap,a,arr(i))))<<SC>>))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 10) ([])>>,and(equals(int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$sum),javaCastInt(bsum{i:int}(Z(0(#)),length(a),int::select(heap,a,arr(i)))))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 12) ([])>>,and(leq(int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$sum),javaMulInt(length(a),int::select(heap,self,SumAndMax::$max)))<<origin(ensures @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 13) ([])>>,java.lang.Object::<inv>(heap,self)<<impl>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>)<<SC>>,equals(exc<<origin(ensures (implicit)) ([])>>,null)<<impl, origin(ensures (implicit)) ([])>>)}; mods: {heap=union(singleton(self,SumAndMax::$sum),singleton(self,SumAndMax::$max))<<origin(assignable @ file SumAndMax.java @ line 8) ([])>>, savedHeap=null}; hasMod: {heap=true, savedHeap=true}; termination: diamond; transaction: false

[ DONE  ... rule application ]
Number of goals remaining open: 0
```

title: Bugfix: make exception dialog able to show files in Jar files
catch headless to make key --auto runnable again
SMT communication rework
description:
Note: Replaces !369. In contrast to the former, this MR still uses the solvers in interactive mode, and solves the synchronization problems by merging stderr and stdout of the external process, and also by avoiding to forcibly destroy pipe and process.

When using an SMT solver from KeY, the solver is started as an external process.
The solvers are used in interactive mode. Problem, commands, output/result, and error messages are exchanged via stdin/stdout/stderr between KeY and the solvers.

However, the current implementation is overly complicated and very difficult to debug.
In addition, the communication is not properly synchronized.
This sometimes leads to very annoying problems, for example:
The result of `get-proof` is not obtained completely before the solver process is destroyed. 

This merge request provides a complete rework of the communication with external SMT solver processes to make it make it easier to debug and get rid of the occasionally occurring "broken pipe" and "stream closed" errors. Note: The counterexample generator also still works.

What has been done:
* stderr of external solver process is redirected to stdout now
* extracted Pipe interface, kept legacy version of Pipe, introduced simpler one which does not spawn receiver threads (2 threads less per running solver instance!)
* removed generics from SolverCommunication, Pipe, and ExternalProcessLauncher
* adapted Z3Socket, Z3CESocket, CVC4Socket (other Sockets still need to be adapted)

TODOs:
* [x] store also solver input in SolverCommunication
* [ ] ~~Check if it is necessary to forcibly destroy pipe and/or process, in case sending "(exit)" fails.~~
* [x] move SMT comm classes to new separate package
* [x] legacy translations (see also [KaKey-2021-07-09](https://git.key-project.org/key/key/-/wikis/KaKey-2021-07-09)):
  - [ ] ~~Z3 legacy fails currently since proof production is disabled -> implement SMT option for proof production?~~
  - [x] Simplify is not available for download any more -> drop support
  - [x] Yices 1.x is also very old (Yices 2.x can not be used, since it does not support quantifiers) -> drop support
  - [x] CVC3 is also outdated -> drop support
* [ ] ~~solver specific information (e.g., input parameters, output handling) should be in a single location for each solver~~
* [ ] ~~update supported versions of solvers (how are these determined?)~~

Note: The points that are struck through need a larger rework of the current infrastructure and are thus postponed and moved to #1574.

title: Set minimum required JDK version to 11.
description:
* Sets the Java version per `--release` flag to 11. 
* Remove the compilation test for JDK8 

closes #1573

title: Better SourceView Tooltip
description:
This MR makes the tooltip in SourceView better (see #1569):
* adds option to toggle
* changes mouse pointer over highlightings to hand
* shorter tooltip

A follow up could be to allow for jumping downwards in the proof tree when clicking non-highlighted lines (first match).

title: Fix bug: missing sonarqube message
description:
Swap lines in gitlab ci, such that sonarqube is always reported.

Currently, the MR comment is skipped if the quality gates fail in sonarqube.

title: Fix \singleton(3)
description:
Add check to ProofJavaParser if `expr` is a reference in `\singleton(expr)`.

Closes #39

title: Better exception message in JML parser
description:
From #39: If I add a `//@ensures \singleton(3) == \singleton(3);` a nasty IOoBounds exception arise, 
because the new JML parser translates this. I now catch these exception and create a better message:

```
The given expression Z(3(#))(type: (type, sort): (int,int)) is not a valid reference./home/weigl/work/key/key/key.core/src/test/resources/testcase/issues/39/A.java:6:15

    //@ensures \singleton(3) == \singleton(3);
              ^
```

title: Translating DL contracts to JML
description:
This MR removes the last DL contracts from KeY and favor of the (more sophisticated) JML contracts.

2. DL-Escape `\dl_XXX` know supports type parameters in a primitive way: `\dl_seqGet` is resolved to `any::seqGet` now.

3. `java.lang.Long` and `java.lang.Boolean` were added to Redux w/o any functionality.


---

These changes are currently not present in this MR. Changes are on `weigl/jmlescapebacktick`.

Alongside the migration some changes to the program code happened 

1. Introduction of the *big JML escape*. With `...` inside JML you can escape to KeY term syntax. 
   For example, ```ensures \result == `\ifEx int x; x>2 \then x \else x-1`;``` is valid know. 
   Not everything is available in the KeY world. You have only access to this (`self`), the parameters, the exception, and 
   result variable.  
  1. The API of `KeYIO` was extended to give positional information (line, column) to have precise feedback on syntax errors in the embedded case    



See issue #204.

title: A better dialog for warnings
description:
This MR brings a more dialog for warnings with support of multi-line message, position information and a preview window. 

Features in detail:

* File preview with Java/JML highlighting 
* All warnings position of a file are highlighted
* Listed warnings can be hidden for reloads in the current session (volatile stored)
* If a warning text contains an URL (e.g., to key-project.org/docs), you can open the URL directly.
        
New Version: 
![image](/uploads/26654d9d98735ad6d64120698305c3b6/image.png)

<!--
Old version: 
![image](/uploads/4e87a7b64c03eb73deaa0808531d34d6/image.png)
-->

title: Resolve "SMT Option GUI throws NPE on startup"
description: Closes #1568

title: Dependency fixes for Gradle 7
description: This MR makes KeY ready for gradle 7+. Gradle 7 removed the `compile` dependencies (long time deprecated) in favor of `implementation` and `api`. Note, `implementation` deps are not transitive (like `compile`). If you want to propagate such deps use `api`.

title: Add setting to disable load examples dialog window
description:
This MR adds a setting to disable the "load examples" dialog window which normally pops up on every startup of KeY
# Why? 
On every startup of KeY, the "load examples" dialog window pops up. Most often, a regular user won't want to load an example though. For me at least, the window became quite annoying after a while and also messed with my desktop environment (KDE) which led to KeY starting minimized, needing even more clicks to start working

# Features and Impact

> Which new new features does this branch add? (e.g. taclets, GUI changes)

* New Setting to disable the load examples window
* If set, the window won't show on startup
 
> Which components should have changed and how?

* ViewSettings from key.core contains a new settings property
* StandardUISettings from key.ui contains a new checkbox
* Main from key.ui contains a new check whether to show the load examples window or not

> What is the impact for using KeY/KeYclipse?

Shouldn't have any impact for KeYclipse, but untested

> What is the impact for development process? (e.g. changes in build script)

None
# Review

> Are there any places that should be reviewed more closely?

The new check in Main in key.ui, I don't think it will break anything, but we should make sure

> Where there any uncertainties during development?

* Whether the new check in Main would have repercussions for other KeY projects as well
* Maybe there is a better way of accessing the Setting in the main class

> What design decisions have been made and how are they implemented?

The new settings resemble the already existing settings

# Persons involved

> Name the developers who contributed (by idea or commit) to this branch.

Alexander Linder

milestone.title: v2.10.0
milestone.description:
The next major version after 2.8.0. 

We decided the following in the KaKeY meetings:
* feature freeze: November 15th
* subsequently: testing by Hiwis
* first week of December: testing and bug fixing event with staff
* release date: shortly prior to christmas, such that it is available for teaching in formal methods course

title: Improved and corrected the verified line wrap algorithm in KeY
description:
Some properties had to be corrected.

Merge is justified as there is a KeY proof for all properties now.
Unfortunately, it requires a lot of using the new SMT translation.

[wrapLines.zproof](/uploads/7e0421d6f7be21ab476e8070a6059380/wrapLines.zproof)
